name: NewYorker
text:
Congratulations to the authors on this year’s #NBAwards longlist for Translated Literature.
https://t.co/UEwllwdG8e

name: NewYorker
text:
The narrator in Sigrid Nunez's latest novel, "What Are You Going Through," embodies the injustices of aging that estrange women from social life, from one another, and from themselves.
https://t.co/KtaqNI2vc5

name: NewYorker
text:
Joe Biden and Kamala Harris’s message to Latino voters comes at a time when the COVID-19 pandemic has fundamentally upended political outreach.
https://t.co/LcPsn03KQx

name: NewYorker
text: "How is it that the world keeps going, breathing in and out unchanged, while in my soul there is a permanent scattering?" @ChimamandaReal remembers her father, who died suddenly this summer, in the family’s ancestral home town, in Nigeria. https://t.co/hu4WY12Big

name: NewYorker
text: "It was in the week after this creation, on the eighth day, that the trouble began: loneliness set in. And so God made a garden." Jamaica Kincaid reflects on her relationship with gardening. https://t.co/c5bCjE29EL

name: NewYorker
text: The field must acknowledge a history of systemic racism while also giving new weight to Black composers, musicians, and listeners. https://t.co/nycqsZSbIn

name: NewYorker
text: Long before Cambridge Analytica, Facebook, or Google, a for-profit data-analytics team built an election simulator that shaped the 1960 Presidential campaign. https://t.co/0HTlq7PKaT

name: NewYorker
text: The inventor Jonathan Rothberg likes to take existing technologies and make them faster, smaller, cheaper, and more readily available. Now he is taking on coronavirus testing. https://t.co/hlaz0hHKFI

name: NewYorker
text: In a new sketch from @tnyshouts, a woman emerges from quarantine for some alone time on the beach. https://t.co/gwxxiXMChu

name: NewYorker
text: In a world that is increasingly multilingual, becoming a hyperpolyglot—a speaker of more than eleven languages—remains a rare, herculean feat. https://t.co/Rreuj7WCdH

name: NewYorker
text: Calvin Tomkins on the many delights of the artist Pipilotti Rist’s videos. “What Rist delivers in abundance is pleasure, something that has been out of bounds in contemporary art since the 1970s.” https://t.co/mFRo25NXqX

name: NewYorker
text:
Donald Trump is highly unpopular with young Latino voters, yet polls also show that this group is deeply cynical about politicians.
https://t.co/MWPvtnx4ng

name: NewYorker
text:
The best-selling writer Susanna Clarke, whose novel “Jonathan Strange & Mr. Norrell” is set in an alternative version of England during the Regency period, says she feels more at home in the 19th century than she does in the present. 
https://t.co/BChi2vwYDl

name: NewYorker
text: In Nigeria, motorcyclists speed against traffic and time to deliver blood to patients. "Blood Rider," a new documentary, follows the life-and-death mission of a deliveryman in Lagos. https://t.co/OaKeOMaHaG

name: NewYorker
text:
To win in battleground states, Joe Biden and Kamala Harris must focus both on inspiring young and old generations of Latino voters and countering a plethora of false information meant to convince them to sit out the election in November.
https://t.co/eUYJdcKYht

name: NewYorker
text:
Compliment: “Your shoes look really comfortable!”
Translation: “It’s so brave of you to turn your back on current trends and embrace orthopedic sandals.”
https://t.co/wWZhNS4mFb

name: NewYorker
text: Like “social distancing,” “flatten the curve,” and “covidiot,” in the past several months, “Zoom fatigue” has joined our pandemic lexicon. Is there a better way to mingle? https://t.co/5wbUKBUiym

name: NewYorker
text: “During COVID the outside was all we had left and now that’s gone too,” one Northern Californian said. “It’s just an unbelievable reckoning of all we’ve done wrong.” https://t.co/6PA4vOJy2H

name: NewYorker
text: RT @erinoverbey: Our own Roger Angell is turning 100 this week! I've been lucky enough to work w/Roger for many yrs & have appreciated his wisdom & guidance. To celebrate, we’ve put together a roundup of some of his @NewYorker archive pieces w/intro by Remnick. Enjoy!  https://t.co/Zn9oGnZcEf

name: NewYorker
text:
Congratulations to all the contenders on this year’s #NBAwards longlist for Poetry, including @VChangPoet, @NatalieGDiaz, and many more.

https://t.co/9VIlmCaITm

name: NewYorker
text: Between 1910 and 1997, African-Americans lost about ninety per cent of their farmland. https://t.co/jEt3loM6l8

name: NewYorker
text:
Beverly Glenn-Copeland describes himself as a "musical monk," creating music that speaks to our desire for a future that never came.
https://t.co/dHw8LGixRk

name: NewYorker
text: "I, Jeff Bezos, the C.E.O. of Amazon and the world’s richest man, plan to use my disproportionate wealth to fight for social justice for bald men and space tourists." https://t.co/PRFbmyRudR
